abstract: The court ruled that a lawsuit claiming off-the-clock violations could proceed as a class action on behalf of nearly 80,000 Wal-Mart employees.
snippet: The court ruled that a lawsuit claiming off-the-clock violations could proceed as a class action on behalf of nearly 80,000 Wal-Mart employees.
lead_paragraph: In a setback for Wal-Mart, the New Jersey Supreme Court ruled yesterday that a lawsuit claiming off-the-clock violations could proceed as a class action on behalf of nearly 80,000 current and former Wal-Mart employees.

headline.main: New Jersey High Court Hands Wal-Mart a Setback
headline.print_headline: Workers’ Suit Against Wal-Mart Granted Class-Action Status in New Jersey
